alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 1:41PM EDT until April 05 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Covington County in south central Alabama... Northeastern Okaloosa County in northwestern Florida... * Until 115 PM CDT. * At 1241 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Andalusia to 11 miles north of Baker, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Florala, Laurel Hill and Lockhart. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central Alabama...and northwestern Florida. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for south central Alabama...and northwestern Florida.
